meanings.sent1: The tricky riddle bemuddled the children.
meanings.sent2: The complex instructions can bemuddle anyone.
meanings.sent3: Trying to solve the puzzle without all the pieces was bemuddling.
meanings.sent4: Her conflicting statements bemuddled his understanding of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The fog of war can bemuddle even the most experienced soldiers.

meanings.sent1: The heavy rain bemuddles the path in the forest.
meanings.sent2: Playing in the rain often bemuddles our clothes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy bemuddled the clean floor with its muddy paws.
meanings.sent4: The construction site quickly bemuddled the once pristine field.
meanings.sent5: The children's playful antics bemuddled the crystal-clear stream.
